intro: Dendrophthora fanshawei, commonly known as the Chinese mistletoe, is a parasitic plant that grows on the branches of other trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is native to China. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white coating. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by berries that are typically red or yellow in color. Due to its parasitic nature, it can affect the health of its host trees if left unchecked.
